Designer, developer, frontender, backender, UX wonk, Project Manager, and Analyst.

Hi, I'm Jason, pleased to be of service.

What can I do for you?

I have spent my career investing in skillsets to meet project and employer needs as they arise. I love having the flexibility to jump in where needed to bring a project along.

Clean, Responsive, Frontend Markup

Frontend is where I got my start. When you need responsive, flexible, templates and layouts I'm ready to help whether you're working with HTML, HAML, PUG, or anything else you'd like.

Purpose Built JS

Need some client side scripting? Want to make your interactions pop? Customize your video player? Hook into the latest Artificial Intelligence API? I can code from scratch or implement libraries as needed.

Backend and APIs

Looking to leverage server side logic or to build an API to share your project with the world? I’m comfortable building up PHP, ASP, and especially NODE backends for your data-driven needs.

Project Management

Whether surveying the bottom of a fjord or building the latest release of your new app, focus, communication, and clear goals will keep things on track. I’ve years of experience managing projects from field work, to procurements, to emergency response, and product development.

Training & Team Development

When your team has the opportunity to try new things and learn new techniques everyone benefits. In my role as an officer I prided myself in finding the best ways to pass on knowledge and help my peers explore their abilities. In my current role I’ve continued to put that experience to use helping my team, from development to customer service to sales, gain the knowledge to help us provide the best experience to our customers.

User Experience

Reaching your users and better understanding their needs and your business needs is at the core of earning users and retaining them. Since my introduction to Human Factors I’ve worked to expand my knowledge of User Experience practices. I pride myself on understanding how details connect to drive the big picture, how responsive design doesn’t end at screen size, and how user experience doesn’t end in the browser.

Business Analysis

You need someone who understands the requirements and processes of design and development and how business needs and processes support or hinder those processes. I’ve combined my years of experience in web development with my project management and operations experience to fulfill that analyst role.

Lately, I've been playing with MAVO, a recently released framework for writing WebApps in HTML.

See the Pen MAVO Playground by Jason Wilson (@SgiobairOg) on CodePen.
